examples: may I ask a few questions?
I will recount a few of the stories told me
many believe it but only a few are prepared to say

pronoun, determiner, &amp; adjective.description: Used to emphasize how small a number of people or things is.
examples: few thought to challenge these assumptions
very few of the titles have any literary merit
a population of fewer than two million
sewing was one of her few pleasures
ask which products have the fewest complaints
one of the few who survived

noun.description: The minority of people; the elect.
examples: a world that increasingly belongs to the few

phrases: She also hopes to visit Britain every few months to attend council meetings.
The emphasis was moving away from local struggles to big protests once every few months.
You've got to understand that he and I only talk once every few months on the phone.
With a bulk shop online once every few weeks you can top up on all basic foodstuffs and household items.
origin: Old English fēawe, fēawa, of Germanic origin; related to Old High German fao, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin paucus and Greek pauros small.
